label.name: Svek
label.contactinfo:
Svek office Stephan Grieder Fax: +46 (8) 50621292
Address: Stephan Grieder Lodgatan 2 114 30 Stockholm Sweden
label.profile:
Swedish record label that mainly released house music, started by [a674] in 1996 and was run together with [a239].
Among the artists who have released music on Svek are, in addition to Stephan Grieder & Jesper Dahlbäck themselves, Bjørn Torske and Cari Lekebusch (under the pseudonym Mr. James Barth) worth mentioning.

label.name: Ruffhouse Records
label.profile:
Founded in 1989 by Chris Schwartz and Philadelphia hip-hop engineer and producer Joe "The Butcher" Nicolo as a joint venture with Columbia Records. Early releases were marketed by [l=Enigma Records (3)]. Artists included Cypress Hill, Kriss Kross, The Fugees and Lauryn Hill.
In 1999, Schwartz and Nicolo stopped the label. Schwartz and Kevon Glickman continued with RuffNation Records; Nicolo continued with Judgement Records. The label was relaunched in July 2012.

label.name: F-111 Records
label.contactinfo: 75 Rockerfeller Plaza New York, NY 10019-6908 USA

label.name: Rather Interesting
label.profile:
R.I. was founded in 1994 by [a=Uwe Schmidt].
In a 2002 [url=http://www.barcodezine.com/Peter%20Namlook%20Interview.html]interview[/url] with FAX founder [a=Pete Namlook] he stated "Rather Interesting is and always was a sub-label of FAX".
[a=Uwe Schmidt] announced in 2012 that Rather Interesting would no longer continue due to the untimely passing of [a=Pete Namlook].
Labelcode [b]LC 6269[/b]

label.name: Deep4Life
label.contactinfo: Deep4Life Recordings P.O. Box 10146, Chicago Il 60610. Phone / Fax: (773) 878-5260 E-mail: deep4life@deep4life.com
label.profile: Electronic music with emphasis on deep house label from Chicago, USA. Started in October 1998 by [a=Chris Gray] with the first release arriving in Spring 1999.

label.name: Naked Music Recordings
label.contactinfo: Naked Music NYC Recordings 4663 18th Street San Francisco, CA, 94114 USA
label.profile: House/downtempo label based in San Francisco, California. Co-founded by [a=Jay Denes] and [a=David Boonshoft], the label was an extension of their production company [l=Naked Music NYC]. [a=Bruno Ybarra] was the label manager from late 1998 to July 2003 and responsible for all A&R, legal, manufacturing, distribution, marketing and promotion. The distinctive artwork on the label's early releases was by [a=Stuart Patterson (8)] at [l=Art Dept. NYC].

label.name: Large Records
label.contactinfo:
1 East Erie St Suite 525-5113 Chicago, IL 60611 United States (USA)
[b]Phone:[/b] +1773 234 6096
[url=mailto:info@largemusic.com]info@largemusic.com[/url]
label.profile:
1990s-2000s house label from Chicago, Illinois.
Founded in 1993 by [a=Jeff Craven] with [a=Gregg Dickson] who also initially founded [l=8th Bar] and [l=Swing Street]. The first incarnation of the Large logo, with the upturned A, was designed by [a=Lil' John Coleman], then buyer at Loop Records in Chicago and the producer responsible for the label's initial release. The label is owned by Jeff Craven and based in Chicago. Label rebranded as [l=Large Music] in the 2000s.

label.name: Glasgow Underground
label.profile:
Glasgow Underground was set up in 1997 by [a=Kevin McKay]. He began the label releasing his own music and collaborations with friends and other Glasgow-based artists ([url=https://www.discogs.com/artist/2046-16B?filter_anv=1&anv=Omid+16B]Omid 16B[/url], [a441], [a447], [a4054]). Through his DJing and work for various music magazines (Muzik, Jockey Slut, Mixmag Update) he met some of his favourite producers of the time ([a2583], [a77], [a170413], et al) and convinced some of them to join him releasing on GU.
In the early 2000s, Kevin met [a=Mylo] and set up the [l=Breastfed Recordings] label. The global success of the "[m53063]" release, meant Glasgow Underground was put on hold. After leaving the Breastfed label in 2011, Kevin re-started Glasgow Underground and since then the label has gone on to re-invigorate Romanthony's catalogue with remixes from the likes of [a4492], [a970905], [a3221], [a1095], [a408185], [a2432212], [a506574], [a2605338], [a3513068], [a50620], [a52501], and [a2293268].
The label has also introduced producers like [a2836171], [a1137042], [a1921483], and [a4482463] as well has releasing established and rising stars such as [a1547806], [a1254764], and [a1100914].

label.name: F Communications
label.contactinfo:
F Communications 8, rue André Messager 75018 Paris - France
Phone: +33 1 47 707 808 Fax: +33 1 47 707 606 E-mail: info@fcom.fr
[reference only; valid in 1998] 11, rue de Clichy 75009 Paris
Phone 33 1 49 706 707 Fax 33 1 44 630 717 Mobile (33) 607 62 85 62
[reference only; valid in 1999] 20/22 rue Richer 75009 Paris
E-Mail: fcom@wanadoo.fr
label.profile:
French Electronic Dance label, founded in 1994 by [a=Eric Morand] and [a=Laurent Garnier] as a successor of [l=Fnac Music Dance Division], 'After E comes F'. Also called fcom. In 1999, it was named "one of France's premier labels specializing in electronic music". In 2003, the record label had a turnover of 2.4 million euros. Label stopped in 2008.
FCom is the result of the meeting at the end of the 80s of two pioneers of the French electronic scene; Laurent GARNIER and Eric MORAND. Their first collaboration dates from 1991, when Eric MORAND suggested that Laurent GARNIER release his first pieces on FNAC MUSIC-DANCE DIVISION, of which he was artistic director. Three years later, after having initiated the first French techno/house label with international influence, we decided to write a new chapter in electronic culture by creating F Communications in April 1994. It features the artists who made the reputation of FNAC MUSIC; Laurent GARNIER, Ludovic NAVARRE, SHAZZ, SCAN
New talents are opening the label to other sounds of other styles. The creativity of the artists pushes the limits of the label. The slogan “electronic with no limit” is essential. Explore, search, Innovate. Experiment without an immediate obligation to achieve results. Priority to emotion, spontaneity.
This experiment is musical but above all a global vision of the label. By launching Laurent GARNIER's first albums "Shot in the Dark" and ST GERMAIN "Boulevard" in 1994, FCOM confirmed that electro can be listened to at home. The success of these two albums established FCOM as a label that discovers and develops talent. The label's influence is immediately global with more than 70% of sales or concert/DJ dates outside France establishing FCOM as the leading French electronic label. Situation confirmed by the success of MR OIZO “Flat beat” in 1999, the album “Newcomer” in 2002 or ALEXKID with “Come with me”.
But more than sales, FCOM's success is its longevity, its image as a quality nursery. Unclassifiable. Unpredictable.
The FCOM evenings, the artists' concerts, the DJs' sets have contributed greatly to the reputation of the label. Whether in clubs, or in festivals (Montreux Jazz, Vielles Charrues, etc.) these are always great moments of meeting between artists and FCOM fans.
We cannot explain FCOM without talking about the visual identity of the label which revealed the graphic design talents of Geneviève Gauckler (1994/1998), Seb Jarnot (1998/2002) or HotSpot Design . Same thing for videos for which we have always favored carte blanche to young directors or artist/director meetings.
FCOM is performances or collaborations at the Palais de Tokyo or Beaubourg. It is also a Lieu Commun launched in May 2005 in Paris with Matali Crasset and Ron Orb. Three universes; Music, design and fashion coming together, three creators, the same vision. A store, a place of welcome, exchanges, sharing where you will discover the entire FCOM catalog and surprises.
FCOM is finally a hotel, the HI Hotel in Nice for which we are doing all the sound design. From the nine room concepts, to the spa, including the swimming pool or the HI bar, all the spaces of this hotel designed by Matali Crasset are bathed in a musical selection made by FCOM. An innovative approach to the relationship with music for an experimental and innovative hotel.
So actually, “what is FCOM”? A label ? A creative bubble? A human adventure?
[Taken from website]
[b]Label Code: LC 01347[/b]
